title: Spectrum of a ring
summary: In commutative algebra, the prime spectrum (or simply the spectrum) of a ring R is the set of all prime ideals of R, and is usually denoted by Spec ‚Å° R {\displaystyle \operatorname {Spec} {R}} ;[1] in algebraic geometry it is simultaneously a topological space equipped with the sheaf of rings O {\displaystyle {\mathcal {O}}} .[2]
